{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General / Factory Manager",
  "description": "Talent Lab Limited -&nbsp;Our client is a leading Nigerian fashion house specialising in bespoke and ready-to-wear clothing. With operations across Nigeria and other African countries, including Mali, they serve high-level clientele that values exclusivity, craftsmanship, and premium service.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General / Factory Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to:&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer

Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day operations of the fashion production unit (bespoke &amp; RTW).
	Ensure garments are produced to the highest quality standards while meeting strict timelines.
	Oversee staff scheduling, task allocation, and performance management of tailors, cutters, designers, and support staff.
	Collaborate with the design team to align production with creative direction and client expectations.
	Monitor inventory of fabrics, trims, and accessories, ensuring cost-effective procurement and usage.
	Implement effective workflow systems that improve speed, reduce errors, and optimize output.
	Liaise with management on expansion projects across African markets and ensure smooth execution of cross-border operations.
	Prepare operational and production reports for management decision-making.
	Uphold brand values by ensuring discretion, professionalism, and premium service standards in all operations.


Required&nbsp;skills&nbsp;and&nbsp;qualifications
Education and Experience:


	Academic qualifications: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Production Management, Fashion, or related field.
	Professional experience: Minimum of 5 years&rsquo; experience in factory, fashion production, or general operations management, preferably in the apparel industry.


Core competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills with the ability to manage both skilled and semi-skilled staff.
	Excellent understanding of garment production processes (pattern-making, cutting, tailoring, finishing, quality control).
	Strong organisational and problem-solving skills; ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Tech-savvy with working knowledge of MS Office; familiarity with fashion ERP or production software is an advantage.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and discretion, especially when dealing with high-profile clientele.
	Must be a resident in Abuja.


Salary
N400,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitments@talentlabltd.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;General/Factory Manager&rdquo; as the subject of the email.

Note


	Apply if you do not currently reside in Abuja.
	Diversity, equity, and inclusion statement:&nbsp;Our client is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We uphold a strict non-discrimination policy, ensuring fair treatment of all applicants and employees, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Talent Lab"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

General / Factory Manager Job at Talent Lab Limited




        
    

        
        Talent Lab Limited - Our client is a leading Nigerian fashion house specialising in bespoke and ready-to-wear clothing. With operations across Nigeria and other African countries, including Mali, they serve high-level clientele that values exclusivity, craftsmanship, and premium service.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General / Factory Manager

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Chief Executive Officer

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage day-to-day operations of the fashion production unit (bespoke & RTW).
	Ensure garments are produced to the highest quality standards while meeting strict timelines.
	Oversee staff scheduling, task allocation, and performance management of tailors, cutters, designers, and support staff.
	Collaborate with the design team to align production with creative direction and client expectations.
	Monitor inventory of fabrics, trims, and accessories, ensuring cost-effective procurement and usage.
	Implement effective workflow systems that improve speed, reduce errors, and optimize output.
	Liaise with management on expansion projects across African markets and ensure smooth execution of cross-border operations.
	Prepare operational and production reports for management decision-making.
	Uphold brand values by ensuring discretion, professionalism, and premium service standards in all operations.


Required skills and qualifications
Education and Experience:


	Academic qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Production Management, Fashion, or related field.
	Professional experience: Minimum of 5 years’ experience in factory, fashion production, or general operations management, preferably in the apparel industry.


Core competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills with the ability to manage both skilled and semi-skilled staff.
	Excellent understanding of garment production processes (pattern-making, cutting, tailoring, finishing, quality control).
	Strong organisational and problem-solving skills; ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Tech-savvy with working knowledge of MS Office; familiarity with fashion ERP or production software is an advantage.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and discretion, especially when dealing with high-profile clientele.
	Must be a resident in Abuja.


Salary
N400,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@talentlabltd.com using “General/Factory Manager” as the subject of the email.

Note


	Apply if you do not currently reside in Abuja.
	Diversity, equity, and inclusion statement: Our client is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We uphold a strict non-discrimination policy, ensuring fair treatment of all applicants and employees, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Marketing Specialist",
  "description": "Koins Microfinance Bank Limited is a fully licensed technology and impact-driven microfinance bank that focuses on driving financial inclusion. Loans / Savings / Investments.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Marketing Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Content Marketing Specialist is responsible for planning, creating, and optimizing video content that supports the company&rsquo;s marketing objectives.
	This role involves scripting, shooting, and editing videos for digital platforms, including social media, websites, email campaigns, and online ads.
	The specialist will work closely with the marketing, design, and product teams to craft compelling visual stories that engage audiences, promote brand awareness, and drive conversions.
	Additionally, the role includes analyzing video performance metrics to refine content strategies and ensure maximum impact.


Requirements


	Education Requirements
	
		B.Sc / HND qualification.
	
	
	1 - 3 years of relevant work experience.&nbsp;
	Technical Skills
	
		Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro,Cap cut).
		Knowledge of motion graphics tools (e.g., After Effects).
		Experience with video production equipment (cameras, lighting, sound).
		Familiarity with video formats, codecs, and optimization for different platforms (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, etc.).
		Understanding of SEO for video (e.g., metadata, thumbnails, captions)
	
	
	Marketing Knowledge
	
		Strong grasp of digital marketing fundamentals and trends.
		Ability to align video content with marketing goals and KPIs (engagement, conversion, retention).
		Experience creating content for ads (YouTube, Facebook, TikTok).
		Understanding of customer journey and how video fits into content strategy.
		Basic knowledge of performance analytics and reporting tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, YouTube Studio)
	
	
	Creative &amp; Communication Skills
	
		Strong storytelling skills and ability to create emotionally engaging content.
		Creative direction and scripting ability.
		Excellent written and verbal communication for cross-team collaboration.
		Ability to work with designers, copywriters, and marketers
	
	


Benefits


	13th Month Salary
	Hybrid work model
	Leave Allowance
	HMO?


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@koinsbank.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Content Marketing Specialist Job at Koins Microfinance Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Koins Microfinance Bank Limited is a fully licensed technology and impact-driven microfinance bank that focuses on driving financial inclusion. Loans / Savings / Investments.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Marketing Specialist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Content Marketing Specialist is responsible for planning, creating, and optimizing video content that supports the company’s marketing objectives.
	This role involves scripting, shooting, and editing videos for digital platforms, including social media, websites, email campaigns, and online ads.
	The specialist will work closely with the marketing, design, and product teams to craft compelling visual stories that engage audiences, promote brand awareness, and drive conversions.
	Additionally, the role includes analyzing video performance metrics to refine content strategies and ensure maximum impact.


Requirements


	Education Requirements
	
		B.Sc / HND qualification.
	
	
	1 - 3 years of relevant work experience. 
	Technical Skills
	
		Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro,Cap cut).
		Knowledge of motion graphics tools (e.g., After Effects).
		Experience with video production equipment (cameras, lighting, sound).
		Familiarity with video formats, codecs, and optimization for different platforms (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, etc.).
		Understanding of SEO for video (e.g., metadata, thumbnails, captions)
	
	
	Marketing Knowledge
	
		Strong grasp of digital marketing fundamentals and trends.
		Ability to align video content with marketing goals and KPIs (engagement, conversion, retention).
		Experience creating content for ads (YouTube, Facebook, TikTok).
		Understanding of customer journey and how video fits into content strategy.
		Basic knowledge of performance analytics and reporting tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, YouTube Studio)
	
	
	Creative & Communication Skills
	
		Strong storytelling skills and ability to create emotionally engaging content.
		Creative direction and scripting ability.
		Excellent written and verbal communication for cross-team collaboration.
		Ability to work with designers, copywriters, and marketers
	
	


Benefits


	13th Month Salary
	Hybrid work model
	Leave Allowance
	HMO?


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@koinsbank.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju, Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Shipping terms in accordance with current version of International Commercial Terms (Incoterms 2010, or the latest update)
	Manage Letters of Credit, from draft presentation through to payment, issuing bank courier information, establishing draft maturity payment dates and forecasting foreign exchange purchases.
	Liaise with suppliers on vendor financing and work with&nbsp; respective Bank and FSS (Shared service) in the payments release

Supply Operations Manager Job at PZ Cussons




        
    

        
        PZ Cussons is a dynamic consumer products group and innovator of some of the world's best known and loved brands. Calling on over 130 years of expertise, we operate internationally in carefully selected developed and emerging markets that present the greatest strategic potential for future growth. Our world-class supply chain and distribution networks enable us to meet our global consumer needs and deliver quality brands that add value and enhance everyday lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Operations Manager

Job Requisition ID: JR002306
Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Accountabilities
     

            
    




	Responsibility for the supply chain, planning, movement, management and distribution of orders while meeting the service demands of the internal and external customers.
	Manages and oversees overall supply chain operations, Purchasing, Freight & Logistics
	 Run and prepare monthly supply chain KPIs
	Work with internal and external stake holders across functional and external vendors , service providers
	Handle day to day operational relating to Trade Finance in Procurement Hub
	In charge of Letter of Credit issuance, negotiation, as per USB/ISBP provision
	Prepare Letters of Credit & Bills of Collection, ensuring that transactions comply with ICC Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits UCP600 and that Terms and Conditions are in accordance with both company standard instructions and also with the specific requirements of the country of import. Shipping terms in accordance with current version of International Commercial Terms (Incoterms 2010, or the latest update)
	Manage Letters of Credit, from draft presentation through to payment, issuing bank courier information, establishing draft maturity payment dates and forecasting foreign exchange purchases.
	Liaise with suppliers on vendor financing and work with  respective Bank and FSS (Shared service) in the payments release
	Manage Service providers and work with Strategic Freight team, local custom, and OUs’ inbound teams to ensure accurate shipping docs and freight rate are compliance
	Act as a hub to get order from PZ operating unit (OU) and publish order to supplier. Make arrangement on order delivery processing with supplier and shipping line to ensure delivery is On Time In Full and in Quality as per PZ OU requirement.


Qualifications
Knowledge / Qualifications:


	Min 4 years of Experience in supply chain or supply planning and experience in managing export shipping document
	Knowledge of logistics, Shipping Document, Incoterm, Letter of Credit, Bank document


Technical / Professional Experience:


	Strong problem solving skills
	The ability to work as part of a multicultural, global team
	Experience of working with ERP systems, ideally SAP
	Fluency in English


Continuous improvement:


	Support & maintain continuous and collaborative improvement initiatives throughout the supply chain.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer",
  "description": "Casalavoro Limited is&nbsp;a fast-growing, multi-sector company with thriving interests in Real Estate, Hospitality, Commodities, With a strong commitment to excellence and innovation, we provide top-tier services that redefine industry standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Front Desk Officer to manage our front desk operations.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, handling visitor registrations, and ensuring a smooth and efficient experience for clients, visitors, and employees.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring that all guests feel welcome and valued.
	Manage the front desk, handling guest registrations, check-ins, and check-outs.
	Handle room assignments, key card management, and guest requests.
	Maintain accurate records of guest interactions, including complaints and compliments.
	Receive and direct visitors, clients, and employees to the relevant personnel or departments.
	Manage and maintain the reception area, ensuring it is clean, organized, and reflects the company&#39;s image.
	Answer and direct phone calls, respond to emails, and handle other forms of communication.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless communication and exceptional customer service.
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area, adhering to company standards.
	Develop and maintain knowledge of hotel services, amenities, and local attractions.
	Provide administrative support to the team, including tasks such as photocopying, scanning, and binding documents.
	Manage and maintain records, files, and databases, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.
	Handle mail and packages, including receiving, sorting, and distributing them to the relevant personnel.
	Provide information and assistance to clients, visitors, and employees, responding to their queries and resolving issues.
	Maintain a high level of customer service, ensuring that all interactions are professional, friendly, and courteous.
	Perform other administrative tasks as required, such as ordering supplies, managing the office calendar, and coordinating meetings and events.


Key Criteria


	HND or Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a front desk or customer service role, preferably in the hospitality industry.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


What We Offer


	Competitive Salary: N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.
	Opportunity to work with a leading hospitality company.
	Collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment.
	Development and training opportunities.
	Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@casalavoro.net&nbsp;using &quot;Front Desk Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }

    }

}



Front Desk Officer Job at Casalavoro Limited




        
    

        
        Casalavoro Limited is a fast-growing, multi-sector company with thriving interests in Real Estate, Hospitality, Commodities, With a strong commitment to excellence and innovation, we provide top-tier services that redefine industry standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Front Desk Officer to manage our front desk operations.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, handling visitor registrations, and ensuring a smooth and efficient experience for clients, visitors, and employees.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring that all guests feel welcome and valued.
	Manage the front desk, handling guest registrations, check-ins, and check-outs.
	Handle room assignments, key card management, and guest requests.
	Maintain accurate records of guest interactions, including complaints and compliments.
	Receive and direct visitors, clients, and employees to the relevant personnel or departments.
	Manage and maintain the reception area, ensuring it is clean, organized, and reflects the company's image.
	Answer and direct phone calls, respond to emails, and handle other forms of communication.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless communication and exceptional customer service.
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area, adhering to company standards.
	Develop and maintain knowledge of hotel services, amenities, and local attractions.
	Provide administrative support to the team, including tasks such as photocopying, scanning, and binding documents.
	Manage and maintain records, files, and databases, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.
	Handle mail and packages, including receiving, sorting, and distributing them to the relevant personnel.
	Provide information and assistance to clients, visitors, and employees, responding to their queries and resolving issues.
	Maintain a high level of customer service, ensuring that all interactions are professional, friendly, and courteous.
	Perform other administrative tasks as required, such as ordering supplies, managing the office calendar, and coordinating meetings and events.


Key Criteria


	HND or Bachelor's Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a front desk or customer service role, preferably in the hospitality industry.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


What We Offer


	Competitive Salary: N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.
	Opportunity to work with a leading hospitality company.
	Collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment.
	Development and training opportunities.
	Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@casalavoro.net using "Front Desk Officer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Female Hotel Supervisor Job at Extramileage Consults Limited




        
    

        
        Extramileage Consults Limited is a full-service Human Resource Outsourcing company servicing different companies in different states across the nation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Hotel Supervisor
Job Location: Ojodu-Berger, Lagos

Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of hotel supervisory experience.


Benefits
     

            
    




	Salary: N100,000 / month
	Staff Lunch
	Monthly Service Charge.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: extramileageconsultslimited@gmail.com using "Female Hotel Supervisor" as the subject of the email.

Note: For more Enquiries, WhatsApp 08037910516.
